page_1.title: Description of the report entries
page_1.date_descr: Date when the operation was executed on.
page_1.account_descr: The account where the operation was performed.
page_1.ticker_descr: The security's ticker. Follows Yahoo Finance standard.
page_1.ter_descr: For eligible products, annualized Total Expense Ratio.
page_1.currency_descr: Currency of the operation. Currently supported: EUR, USD.
page_1.exch_rate_descr: EUR-USD conversion rate of the operation.
page_1.qt_exch_descr: Quantity of the security exchanged in the current operation. Positive if Buy, negative if Sell.
page_1.price_descr: Unit price in original currency. Negative if Buy, positive if Sell.
page_1.eur_price_descr: Unit price in EUR. Negative if Buy, positive if Sell.
page_1.nominal_value_descr: Direct value of the operation. For securities, equals Exch. Qty * Price EUR.
page_1.fees_descr: Commissions applied by the broker for the operation.
page_1.qt_held_descr: Current quantity of the security after the current operation.
page_1.avg_price_descr:
Average Cost Price of the security. Prices include commissions. Calculated as
( sum[i=1->n] Qty[i] * Price[i] )  /  ( sum[i=1->n] Qty[i] )
page_1.avg_value_descr:
Residual amount of the asset.
Calculated as Avg Cost * Curr. Qty.
page_1.eff_value_descr: Effective amount of the operation net of any commissions.
page_1.released_value_descr:
Cost released after the sale of an asset.
Calculated as Avg Cost * Exch. Qty.
page_1.gross_cap_gain_descr:
Gross capital gain generated by the sale.
Calculated as Eff. Value - Cost Released.
page_1.cap_loss_descr:
Capital loss generated by the operation.
For some products (e.g., ETFs) can also be generated on purchase (fee loss).
page_1.exp_date_descr: Expiration date of the capital loss, after which it can no longer be offset.
page_1.backpack_descr: Tracks total capital losses yet to be offset, and handles removing them upon expiration.
page_1.cap_gain_tax_descr:
Capital gain on which tax will actually be paid. Reduced by the Tax Carryforward in case of offsettable capital losses.
Assuming gain=20€, carryforward=5€, tax is paid only on 20-5 = 15€, instead of 20€.
page_1.tax_amount_descr: Tax actually paid, calculated on the taxable capital gain.
page_1.pl_descr: Profit & Loss of the sale. Calculated as Gross Cap Gain - Tax.
page_1.cash_held_descr: Cash available in the account after the operation.
page_1.assets_value_descr: Value of securities held in the account after the operation.
page_1.nav_descr: Net Asset Value after the operation. Calculated as Current Cash + Asset Value.
page_1.historic_cash_descr: Total liquidity injected into the account. Considers only deposits and withdrawals.

page_2.title: Portfolio Statistics
page_2.xirr_descr:
A type of Return. The IRR is a numerical method to calculate the Internal Rate of Return of a series of cash flows (inflows and outflows); XIRR is a variant used when flows occur at irregular time intervals. It is calculated as the rate that zeros the Net Present Value (NPV) of all flows.
Useful for measuring personal performance, taking into account investment and divestment choices.
page_2.twrr_descr:
A type of Return. Focuses on the return of the assets and not the effective return of the investor (essentially excluding cash flows).
The calculation is based on the geometric mean of returns of all sub-periods into which the investment is divided (e.g., daily, monthly).
Useful for comparing performance with benchmarks/indices or measuring statistics such as the Sharpe Ratio.
page_2.volatility_descr: Standard deviation of returns over a specific time period.
page_2.sharpe_ratio_descr:
Measures the performance of an investment compared to a "risk-free" asset (e.g., AAA short-term government bonds' interest rate).
It is calculated as the difference between investment returns and risk-free returns, called excess returns, divided by the standard deviation of excess returns.

page_3.title: Correlation Analysis
page_3.corr_simple_descr:
Measures, via a coefficient between -1 and 1, how correlated two assets are at a given moment.
+1: the two assets are positively correlated: as one increases, the other increases too.
0: the two assets are perfectly uncorrelated, they do not affect each other.
-1: the two assets are negatively correlated: as one increases, the other decreases.
page_3.corr_roll_descr:
Calculated similarly to the previous one, but over a pre-established time interval (e.g., 5 years); furthermore, a rolling average with a specified interval (in days) is applied.
This interval is recommended to be 100-150 for a history greater than 2 years, 20-60 otherwise.
Offers a measure of how the correlation between two assets changes over time.

page_4.title: Drawdown Analysis
page_4.drawdown_descr:
Measures the percentage decline in the value of the portfolio (or an asset) from its historic peak to the subsequent minimum.
Maximum Drawdown, specifically, reports the largest difference.

page_5.title: Value at Risk
page_5.var_descr:
Maximum expected loss over a specified time horizon in days, given a confidence interval.
The higher the number of projected days, the less reliable the results.
The implementation used here is based on the Monte Carlo method, using historical data for return estimates.
